thread.title: School students are using delivery apps like Uber Eats
thread.title_full: School students are using delivery apps like Uber Eats

title: School students are using delivery apps like Uber Eats
text: Share this article Share 'We deliver direct to the school's front office in 30 minutes, providing teachers and students with a quick, easy and often healthier alternative to the canteen.' At Cranbrook School in Sydney's eastern suburbs, senior school day students use all three of the food delivery apps regularly and they have proved popular. UberEats, Deliveroo, and Foodora, are just three of the food delivery apps that are currently being used (stock image) Tim Browning, head of senior school at Cranbrook, said the popular food apps were used 'primarily by HSC students attending the campus after hours up to 9pm at night and on Saturdays and Sundays'. 'The deliveries are brought to the school gate. We provide high quality and healthy food for growing boys in our school tuckshop during normal school hours, and encourage healthy eating habits through our sports programme,' Mr Browning said. UberEats would not comment on their latest venture due to their privacy rules, but Foodora said it was aware of the potential market in school deliveries. But in their experience so far it remained a 'small' growing trend. At Cranbrook School in Sydney's eastern suburbs (pictured, stock image), senior school day students use a combination of all three food apps Read more: Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
